results.content:
Instructor needs to invest in a new microphone. The audio in this course is incredibly grating and difficult to listen to for more than a few minutes at a time. Add to that an accent (which I don't mind on its own) and it becomes very hard to understand at times.

The lectures seem unprepared and repetitive. For a two hour course, you'd expect succinct and to-the-point instruction. Not the case for this course. Instructor fumbles around debugging like this were a live lecture.

I'm a big fan of Udemy in general but I feel ripped off by this course and simply cannot fathom how it could possibly have reached the 4.4 average rating it currently has.

response.content:
Hi aj, first of all thank you so much for the review. 
1) You said you didn't like the audio quality and the accent. I think you are right, I do need a better microphone. But that's what the preview lectures are for. You can judge the quality of the audio and the accent of the instructor using the preview lectures before purchasing the course. And even after purchasing the course, Udemy has a 30 day refund policy.
2) As far as my preparedness is concerned, there is just one part in just one lecture where I actually had to go back and correct my code after realizing my mistake. I didn't remove that part intentionally because it teach the students how to go about debugging your code. I could have easily re-recorded that lecture but I didn't. And I will surely keep these points in mind for the upcoming lectures.
But because you are feeling ripped off by this course, I can't keep the fees. I will check with the Udemy team if there's any way I can refund the entire amount of the course to a student.
Have a nice day!

results.content: Videos do not iterate on the previous. I’ve watched him create a manifest file about every video.

response.content:
Hi Ngoc Phan, thank you so much for the review. Creating a manifest file for every video was intentional, because Initially I panned the course keeping in mind the students who like to code along and also manifest file is the foundation of any Chrome Extension, So I thought it would be better to repeat them to get the process registered in the minds of the students. Moreover, Not all the manifest files are the same except the first three mandatory fields.

Anyway, I am extremely sorry you didn't enjoy the course. I will definitely keep this point in mind while planning the future lessons. Again thank you so much for the review. Have a nice day!
